title: How helpful is writing letters to god? - Quora

response.answer_text: I recommend WhatsApp/Line, etc… is free and doesn’t waste paper, lead/ink, eraser, etc. Help the planet, since your god doesn’t. Also, why write? Can’t he read your mind, prays, etc.? Writing seems…. like you doubt what you believe in then. Or at least don’t follow “everything” they teach. No? But hey, if you still don’t care about the planet, still think writing is “more efficient”, and like “double-talking” to your god,…. then go ahead. At least when our kids write to Santa, it makes more sense since they are small and don’t think like an adult. Just saying. ;)

It can be quite helpful, though not in terms of God responding. (I’m an atheist, so I don’t think there is a god that can respond.) The benefit for the letter writer is a clarification of his or her thoughts, wishes, and plans. It’s helpful in much the same way that a journal can be helpful, and writing about one’s feelings (for example) can help one understand and deal with them better. (See the book Opening Up for a good description of benefits.)
